subject: Leadership
title: Moral Courage
description: A micro-lesson that makes Moral Courage usable.

hook.text: Knowing right from wrong is easy. Acting on it when there's a cost? That takes moral courage.

buildup.text: Kidder defines moral courage: doing what's right despite risk to reputation, career, or relationships.

discovery.text: Research on moral courage shows three ingredients: moral awareness, willingness to act, and tolerance of risk.

twist.text: Organizations that punish truth-tellers train cowardice. Courage requires a system that doesn't destroy the courageous.

climax.text: Build your courage muscle: start with small acts of honesty. Each one makes the next easier. Courage compounds.

punchline.text: Moral courage isn't fearlessness. It's acting despite the fear.

quiz.question: What three ingredients does moral courage require?
options: Moral awareness, willingness to act, and tolerance of risk
